title: Vaccine passports raise questions in US as other countries require them
description: CNN's Brian Todd takes a closer look at the use of vaccine passports as more countries in Europe require them.

title: 'Real Housewife' walks into a beehive and jumps in pool to escape them
description: Watch reality TV star Kyle Richards jump in her pool to escape bees. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the stinging report.

title: London floods are the latest sign that rich cities are dangerously unprepared for climate change
description: Cars stranded in streets turned to rivers. Bus passengers rescued by raft. Train stations submerged, sparking travel chaos.

title: 'Unacceptable': Reporter reacts to Flynn's remark after he was gifted a rifle
description: CNN's Jake Tapper and Politico reporter Rachel Bade discuss recent inflammatory comments by Former Trump security adviser Michael Flynn after he was given an AR-15.

title: See what Macron said about anti-vaccine protesters
description: France's President Emanuel Macron criticized protesters who believe they should be free to reject the Covid-19 vaccines.

title: US and China trade barbs after latest tense high-level meeting
Beijing's regulatory crackdown hits stocks in China and the US
description: Allianz Chief Economic Adviser Mohamed El-Erian discusses China's regulatory crackdown on private education firms.

title: Philip Morris wants cigarettes banned in the UK by 2030
description: Philip Morris International says it will stop selling Marlboro cigarettes in Britain within a decade as it called on the UK government to ban the sale of its tobacco products.

title: What Sarah Sanders gets wrong about the Covid-19 vaccine
description: Here's the headline out of an op-ed Sarah Sanders wrote in the Arkansas Democrat Gazette on Sunday: She got vaccinated "a few months ago" against the Covid-19 virus.

title: Parents slam US attempt to suppress intelligence work details of woman accused of killing teen son
7 people dead, several more injured after sandstorm leads to 20-vehicle crash
description: Six people are dead and several more were critically injured when authorities say a sand or dust storm caused visibility issues that led to a series of crashes involving 20 vehicles in Utah Sunday evening.

title: Biden to announce end of combat mission in Iraq as he shifts US foreign policy focus
description: President Joe Biden will agree Monday to formally conclude the US combat mission in Iraq by the end of the year, another step toward winding down the two prolonged military engagements that began in the years following the September 11 terror attacks.

title: Math genius just pulled off one of the biggest shocks in Olympics history
Canada's first Indigenous governor general is installed
description: Indigenous leader and advocate Mary Simon has been installed as Canada's governor general.

title: See disaster-stricken lagoon turned pink
description: A lagoon in Argentina has turned pink after experts and activists say the water was polluted from a nearby factory.

title: The Math PhD who pulled off one of the biggest shocks in Olympics history
description:
• Philippines gets its first ever gold medal 
• Who else won gold medals on Monday

title: Tunisia political turmoil deepens as President sacks prime minister, freezes Parliament
description: Tunisia's president dismissed the government and froze parliament on Sunday, prompting crowds to fill major cities in support of a move that dramatically escalated a political crisis, but that his opponents called a coup.

title: 'The Simpsons' is doing something it's never done before
description: "The Simpsons" will kick of its 33rd season with an all-musical episode.

title: Why Germany's gymnasts are wearing body-covering unitards at the Tokyo Games
description: The German women's gymnastics team has forgone bikini-cut unitards in favor of full-body versions at the Tokyo Olympics, in what the German Gymnastics Federation has branded a statement against "sexualization."

title: Bipartisan infrastructure talks sputtering along with little time left
description: After spending the weekend negotiating, lawmakers have yet to clinch a bipartisan infrastructure deal, a precarious sign for senators who have months trying to cement a massive, bipartisan win for President Joe Biden.

title: Huge sandstorm engulfs city in China
description: A sandstorm as high as 100 meters (328 feet) hit Dunhuang City in northwestern China on July 25. Local police imposed traffic controls on the city's expressway as visibility reduced to less than five meters.

title: Civilian casualties in Afghanistan hit record high amid US withdrawal, UN says
description: Civilian casualties in Afghanistan reached record levels in the first half of 2021, the United Nations warned Monday, noting that deaths and injuries spiked markedly from May when the United States and its allies began withdrawing troops from the country.

title: 'What you're doing is unprecedented': McCarthy-Pelosi feud boils over
description: The relationship between House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy was never very warm. Now it's in the down-right gutter.

title: China's escalating crackdown on business is moving stocks
description: The whims of regulators in Beijing have always posed a risk to investors looking to tap into growth in China, the world's second largest economy. But navigating a worsening crackdown on private business is becoming increasingly tricky.

title: China looks to outshine Japan at next year's winter Olympic games
description: These are not the Olympics of Japan's dreams. The Games were supposed to be a comeback after decades of economic stagnation and devastation from the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster. With geopolitical rival China hosting the Winter Olympics, Japan wants to avoid losing center stage. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: China's private education firms are the latest targets of Beijing's crackdown
description: Chinese officials are turning their crackdown on private business to yet another industry: education.

title: 'Home and Away' star dead at 45
description: Dieter Brummer, the Australian actor best known for his role as heartthrob Shane Parrish on TV soap "Home and Away," has died at the age of 45.

title: Bitcoin, dogecoin and ethereum are suddenly having another great week
description: Cryptocurrencies rallied Monday, just a week after they were hit by a major sell-off.

title: Trump's appointees are turning the Supreme Court to the right with different tactics
description: The three appointees of former President Donald Trump have together sealed the Supreme Court's conservatism for a generation, but they have revealed strikingly different methods. They diverge in their regard for practical consequences, their desire to lay down markers for future disputes and their show of internal rivalries.

title: Huge wildlife camera trap study is turned into a game
description: Tasked with photographing one of the world's most elusive big cats, you trek deep into the lush jungle of Southeast Asia and set up a camera trap. Back at base camp, you methodically comb through the images it captures, identifying monkeys, otters and finally, what you've been searching for: the mysterious clouded leopard.

title: Tens of thousands of customers remain without power after tornadoes tore through Michigan
description: Thousands of customers are still without power after three tornadoes tore through Michigan over the weekend, leaving damage, debris and power outages across the Detroit area.

title: Sydney Covid cases expected to rise after anti-lockdown protest as two charged for allegedly hitting police horse
description: Two men have been charged with animal cruelty for allegedly striking a police horse during anti-lockdown protests in Sydney, Australia on Saturday, police said, as daily Covid-19 cases in New South Wales state continue to rise.

title: The Soviet spy steam railway that's still running
description: Deep in the dense green forests of Germany's Mittelgebirge central mountains lies a remarkable railway that has survived war, political upheaval, Cold War tension and repression, economic hardship and repeated threats of closure.

title: Pakistani Taliban leader reacts to Afghan gains after US withdrawal
description: In a CNN exclusive, Noor Wali Mehsud, the leader of Pakistan's Tehrik-i-Taliban, discusses the group's relationship with Afghanistan's Taliban in his first television interview. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

title: Analysis: Critics say Xi has made himself the biggest threat to the Communist Party
description: In January 2013, months after taking the helm of China's ruling party, Xi Jinping gathered the country's top politicians and asked them why the Communist Party of the Soviet Union had collapsed.

title: US Air Force to send dozens of F-22 fighter jets to the Pacific amid tensions with China
description: The United States Air Force is sending more than two dozen F-22 stealth fighters to an exercise in the western Pacific this month, an unusually large deployment of the powerful jets that analysts say sends a strong message to a possible adversary in China.

title: US general vows to continue airstrikes supporting Afghan troops fighting Taliban
description: The US will continue airstrikes in support of Afghan forces fighting the Taliban, a top US general said Sunday.

title: Thunderstorms cause flash flooding in London
description:
• More than 130 dead in India as rains trigger floods, landslides
• California's largest wildfire is threatening thousands of structures

title: Cops rush to lift car off of trapped baby and mom
description: Two police officers and bystanders saved an 8-month-old baby who became trapped underneath a car after a driver hit a 36-year-old mother and her baby in Yonkers, New York, according to a press release from the Yonkers Police Department.
